title: Coronation Street's Katie McGlynn 'gained a stone portraying Sinead's death'
text:

Katie McGlynn has spoken out about the emotions surrounding the death of her character Sinead Tinker in Coronation Street .

The actress has said the storyline was 'stressful' and she began 'comfort eating' as she became consumed about the end of Sinead's life.

The 26-year-old's character finally lost her battle with cancer in the ITV soap last week, with viewers in tears as Sinead passed away.

It was an emotional time for Katie too and she admitted that between filming the scenes, she was “just grabbing food and not really thinking about good nutrition.”

She told the Sunday Mirror that she began comfort eating which led to her putting on a stone in weight.

(Image: Sunday Mirror)

(Image: ITV)

Katie said: “The emotion involved in Sinead dying meant I was just grabbing food and not really thinking about good nutrition.

“I was so tired when I got home that I’d order a takeaway. On set, there were a lot of chocolates, flap jacks and treats flying around.”

There has been much praise for Katie's portrayal, as Sinead died while her husband Daniel Osbourne was reading a bedtime story to their son Bertie.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: Sunday Mirror)

Katie herself took to Instagram after the heartbreaking episode to share her last words about the character she had played for seven years.

She shared a photo of her character and captioned it: "Sinead Osbourne, for nearly 7 years since you first walked the cobbles @coronationstreet, you have been such a massive part of my life..

"It’s been a rollercoaster of a ride, highs, lows, a crash, broken back, proposals, weddings, pregnancy, abortion and now devastingly cancer... [sic]

(Image: PA)

"For Sinead to be leaving this way means EVERYTHING to me! Raising so much awareness for cervical cancer, cancer in young people and cancer in/around pregnancy... It’s been a pleasure, privilege and honour to work alongside such talented people; producers, writers, directors, cast, crew...absolutely every single person at Coronation Street, I will miss you so much! #RIPSineadOsbourne #sineadtinker #corrie #sinead #cervicalcancer."

Sinead's death had also been difficult for Katie's co-star Sally Dynevor to watch.

The Weatherfield legend had battled breast cancer in the past and the soap veteran of 32 years found it an uncomfortable reminder of her personal past.

(Image: Ken McKay/ITV/REX/Shutterstock)

The 56-year-old had found a lump in 2010 and was diagnosed with cancer but after chemotherapy treatment, she was given the all-clear.

Speaking to The Mirror previously, Sally said: "I just can’t watch it. I think they’re doing a ­brilliant job, so brilliant it makes me not want to watch it.

"Only because it’s self-preservation. I don’t need to keep going there."

(Image: Mandatory Credit: WENN.com)

She added: "Even now it’s all mixed up in my head. I don’t think I’ve dealt with it about who this has ­happened to. I still do have the fear. I don’t think it ever goes. It stays with you.

"It does get better but it’s always there at the back of your mind."

description: Katie was 'consumed' by the storyline which had a detrimental effect on her personal health and eating
